actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9285.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9285 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 3913 Leland Avenue Northwest in Comstock Park, Michigan, as the "Captain Miguel Justin Nava Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8909.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8909 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 82-6110 Mamalahoa Highway in Captain Cook, Hawaii, as the "Army 1st Lt. John Kuulei Kauhaihao Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 10065.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 10065 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 802 North Tancahua Street in Corpus Christi, Texas, as the "Captain Robert E. 'Bob' Batterson Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8868.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8868 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 609 Portsmouth Avenue in Greenland, New Hampshire, as the "Chief Michael Maloney Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7508.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7508 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1285 Emancipation Highway in Fredericksburg, Virginia, as the "Gladys P. Todd Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7158.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7158 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 201 East Battles Road in Santa Maria, California, as the "Larry Lavagnino Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6116.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 6116 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 14280 South Military Trail in Delray Beach, Florida, as the "Benjamin Berell Ferencz Post Office Building"."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9600.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9600 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 119 Main Street in Plains, Georgia, as the "Jimmy and Rosalynn Carter Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8919.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8919 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 151 Highway 74 South in Peachtree City, Georgia, as the "SFC Shawn McCloskey Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8717.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8717 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 20 West Main Street in Santaquin, Utah, as the "SGT Bill Hooser Post Office Building"."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9598.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 9598 — "To amend the Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act to reauthorize such Office, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1695.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1695 — "To improve the visibility, accountability, and oversight of agency software asset management practices, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8841.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8841 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 114 Center Street East in Roseau, Minnesota, as the "Floyd B. Olson Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8976.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Burchett moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8976 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 20 West White Street in Millstadt, Illinois, as the "Corporal Matthew A. Wyatt Post Office"."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 709.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Burchett moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. S. 709 — "To improve performance and accountability in the Federal Government, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9360.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Burchett moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9360 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 300 Macedonia Lane in Knoxville, Tennessee, as the "Reverend Harold Middlebrook Post Office Building"."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 4, 2024, at 11:23 a.m.: That the Senate passed S. 1956, S. 2514, S. 3277, S. 4107, S. 4243, S. 4569, S. 5355, H.R. 5536, and H.R. 7764. Appointment: Co-Chairperson of the Commission on the Future of the Navy.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1602, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1602.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1602 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5349) to develop and disseminate a civic education curriculum and oral history resources regarding certain political ideologies, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7198) to amend title 5, United States Code, to require greater transparency for Federal regulatory decisions that impact small businesses, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 perside of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mrs. Hinson to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 4.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Jake LaTurner to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
